Looking for an interesting sauce for pasta? Pasta with sweet potato and cream sauce

• Half a package of pasta (250 grams)
• 2 small peeled sweet potatoes, cut in half
• Small onion, finely chopped
• 2 cloves of garlic
• 1 can of 15% cooking cream (250 ml)
• 1/4 cup of crumbled Parmesan cheese
• Seasoning: 1/3 teaspoon salt, pinch of black pepper
• For sprinkling on top (optional): chopped chives/parsley, crumbled/grated Parmesan cheese

• Cook the pasta according to the instructions on the package. Transfer to a colander, drizzle with a little olive oil and mix.
• Cook the sweet potatoes in boiling water until you can easily pierce them with a fork. Drain and blend with a stick blender until smooth.
• Finely chop the onion and garlic cloves.
• Heat a pan with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, add the onion and garlic and fry until lightly golden. Add the sweet potato puree and cooking cream and mix until combined. Add Parmesan cheese, salt and black pepper and mix.
• Mix the sauce with the pasta and sprinkle over chopped chives/chopped parsley leaves and Parmesan cheese.
A classic creamy beef stroganoff with mushrooms and onions

• 500 grams of beef strips
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 onion, sliced
• 2 cups mushrooms, sliced
• 1 cup beef broth
• 1/2 cup cooking cream (non-dairy, for pareve)
• 1 tablespoon mustard
• Seasoning: salt, black pepper, paprika

• Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté the onion and mushrooms until golden.
• Add the beef strips and cook until browned.
• Stir in the beef broth and bring to a simmer.
• Add mustard, cooking cream, and season with salt, black pepper, and paprika.
• Simmer for 10-15 minutes until the sauce thickens.
• Serve over rice or pasta.
A rich and spicy chicken curry with coconut milk

• 500 grams of chicken breast, cut into cubes
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 onion, finely chopped
• 2 cloves of garlic, minced
• 1 can of coconut milk (400 ml)
• 2 tablespoons curry powder
• 1 teaspoon turmeric
• Seasoning: salt, black pepper
• Optional: fresh cilantro for garnish

• Heat olive oil in a pot and sauté the onion and garlic until fragrant.
• Add the chicken cubes and cook until golden on all sides.
• Stir in curry powder, turmeric, salt, and black pepper.
• Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a boil.
• Simmer for 20 minutes until the chicken is fully cooked and the sauce thickens.
• Serve with rice or naan bread.
A cheesy and creamy lasagna with layers of pasta and cheese

• 9 lasagna sheets
• 2 cups ricotta cheese
• 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
• 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
• 1 jar of marinara sauce (500 ml)
• 1 egg
• Seasoning: salt, black pepper, oregano

• Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
• In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, egg, salt, and pepper.
• Spread a thin layer of marinara sauce in a baking dish.
• Layer lasagna sheets, ricotta mixture, marinara sauce, and mozzarella cheese.
• Repeat until all ingredients are used, ending with a layer of mozzarella cheese.
• Bake for 35-40 minutes until golden and bubbly.
A classic creamy Alfredo pasta dish

• 400 grams of fettuccine pasta
• 2 tablespoons butter
• 2 cloves of garlic, minced
• 1 cup heavy cream
• 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
• 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
• Seasoning: salt, black pepper

• Cook the fettuccine pasta according to package instructions.
• In a pan, melt the butter and sauté garlic until fragrant.
• Stir in the heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
• Add Parmesan cheese, nutmeg, salt, and black pepper, stirring until smooth.
• Toss the cooked fettuccine in the sauce until coated.
• Serve with extra Parmesan cheese on top.
Crispy and golden home fries with a hint of spices, perfect as a side dish or snack

• 4 medium potatoes, peeled and diced into cubes
• 2 tablespoons olive oil
• 1 teaspoon paprika
• 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
• 1/2 teaspoon onion powder
• 1/4 teaspoon chili powder (optional)
• Seasoning: salt, black pepper
• Optional: chopped parsley for garnish

• Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and cook the diced potatoes for 5 minutes. Drain and let cool.
• Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
• Add the potatoes to the skillet in a single layer and cook without stirring for 5 minutes until golden and crispy on one side.
• Flip the potatoes and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally for even crispiness.
• Sprinkle paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder (if using), salt, and black pepper over the potatoes.
• Stir well to coat the potatoes with the spices.
• Remove from heat and garnish with chopped parsley if desired.
• Serve hot as a side dish or a snack.
